summary: Year is not over yet...

animeList.title: Bocchi the Rock!
animeList.comment: Went in with no expectations, came out with a new favorite of the genre as it blew me away with its charm. Banger music as well!

animeList.title: Chainsaw Man
animeList.comment: Despite the discourse online, I did quite enjoy MAPPA's adaptation of it.

animeList.title: Kotaro Lives Alone
animeList.comment: A heartwarming and melancholic tale that caught me off guard with how easily it made me cry ;-;

animeList.title: Suzume
animeList.comment: Only Shinkai film to have made me ugly cry in the movie theater, bravo!

summary: "Are the members of this 'Kessoku Band from Bocchi the Rock' in this room with us right now?"

animeList.title: Gintama: The Final
animeList.comment: No sequels but like it's Gintama so I make exception, best ending to best series.

animeList.title: ODDTAXI
animeList.comment: The definitive dark horse of the year, great plot that all tied together at the end, entertaining!

summary: Year I graduated High School!

animeList.title: Keep Your Hands Off Eizouken!
animeList.comment: Very detailed and entertaining look into the Anime industry. Except it's not, it's just a Slice of Life about girls making Anime, directed by Masaaki Yuasa! (I did not copy-paste this from SHIROBAKO.)

summary: I blame COVID for the lack of goodness.

animeList.title: Dr. Stone
animeList.comment: Great Anime for science nerds, made me appreciate what we have more times than I can count.

animeList.title: Kaguya-Sama: Love is War
animeList.comment: One of the only romances that I honestly really enjoyed, comedy was well done and characters are fun!

summary: There's also Demon Slayer, but eeeeeeeh.

animeList.title: A Place Further Than the Universe
animeList.comment: Made me want to go places - not necessarily Antarctica though o.o

animeList.title: Devilman Crybaby
animeList.comment: Masaaki Yuasa shill moment. Not meant for the faint of heart.

animeList.title: Laid-Back Camp
animeList.comment: Best △ Slice △ Of △ Life △ Saved △ Me △ During △ COVID

animeList.title: Violet Evergarden
animeList.comment: KyoAni shill moment. Simply gorgeous.

summary: The year I pretty much actively started watching Anime, it's been long since then!

animeList.title: Girls' Last Tour
animeList.comment: Something about this one is just inexplicably captivating.

animeList.title: Land of the Lustrous
animeList.comment: Impressive 3DCG Animation start to finish, Studio Orange always knocks it out of the park!

animeList.title: Made in Abyss
animeList.comment: "Never judge a book by its cover" the Anime :skull:

summary: It was not my intention to have 3 (kind of) depressing works all together it really didn't occur to me but I do love all 3 >,<

animeList.title: A Silent Voice
animeList.comment: One of my favorite movies, the ending gets me every time!

animeList.title: March Comes in Like a Lion
animeList.comment: Dripping with human emotion, a complex, soothing, and melancholic story that never fails to immerse me.

animeList.title: Mob Psycho 100
animeList.comment: ONE-sensei's storytelling talent radiates from its uniquely awesome style, also has Reigen in it so yeah.

animeList.title: Mobile Suit Gundam Thunderbolt: December Sky
animeList.comment: Honestly speaking, I never ever expected Gundam and Jazz to mix together so well!

summary: Great soundtracks all around this year!

animeList.title: Assassination Classroom
animeList.comment: My mom will never understand why I broke out sobbing that one night at 3 am.

animeList.title: Mobile Suit Gundam: The Origin
animeList.comment: While the Gundam Franchise is massive and hard to take a bite out of, the Origin is a neat entry that introduces some characters from the classic.

animeList.title: One Punch Man
animeList.comment: While the sequel to it is a dissapointment, the first Season of OPM is masterclass and simply gorgeous animation.

summary: My AOTY was actually Gintama° (big surprise I know @.@).

animeList.title: HAIKYU!!
animeList.comment: Awesome energy, I hate sports but loved this!

animeList.title: Ping Pong the Animation
animeList.comment: Another great sports Anime, unique style and great direction by Masaaki Yuasa as always.

animeList.title: SHIROBAKO
animeList.comment: Very detailed and entertaining look into the Anime industry. (I did not copy-paste this from Bakuman.)

summary: So now that I've seen Bakuman and SHIROBAKO, I basically know everything about the Anime and Manga industry right..? LOL no.

animeList.title: Attack on Titan
animeList.comment: It's just that popular, might as well give it a try yeah?

animeList.title: Kill la Kill
animeList.comment: TRIGGER doing TRIGGER things for TRIGGER enjoyers who love it when TRIGGER says "It's TRIGGERin' time" and TRIGGERs all over the place.

animeList.title: The Wind Rises
animeList.comment: It do be Ghbili it do be a banger it do be your average Ghibli banger.

summary: To be perfectly honest, I don't like AoT that much..

animeList.title: From the New World
animeList.comment: Cool world-building with some intriguing ideologies and philosophies paired with a great soundtrack. Good length for its story as well!

summary: Shinsekai Yori more like Shinsekai Yuri I mean what?

animeList.title: Anohana: The Flower We Saw That Day
animeList.comment: A heartwarming tale of friendship and love.

animeList.title: Nichijou
animeList.comment: One of the first Anime that I watched, hilarious and highly entertaining.

animeList.title: Steins;Gate
animeList.comment: Banger OP, complete and awesome story, the best vieweing experience and great Sci-Fi, what more can one ask for?

summary: Quote of the year: 『日々私たちが過ごしている日常は、実は、奇跡の連続なのかもしれない』or "The ordinary days that we live in may, in fact, be a series of miracles."

animeList.title: And Yet the Town Moves
animeList.comment: SHAFT's mundane tale of a maid yet mixed with raw absurdity, very fun!

animeList.title: Bakuman.
animeList.comment: Very detailed and entertaining look into the Manga industry.

animeList.title: Durarara!!
animeList.comment: Insanely fun, brilliant cast of characters that all shine under the spotlight.

animeList.title: The Tatami Galaxy
animeList.comment: The Anime that changed my life for the better, it's truly a once-in-a-lifetime experience.

summary: Watching Bakuman is probably the fastest I've ever binged Anime, iirc I finished all 3 Seasons (75 Episodes) within 3 days o.0!

animeList.title: Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood
animeList.comment: Consistently good, truly deserves its throne among a big part of the Anime community.

animeList.title: K-On!
animeList.comment: Yui my beloved, KyoAni my beloved, CGDCT my beloved~

animeList.title: Redline
animeList.comment: The adrenaline pumper movie, exquisite animation from start to finish.

summary: Yui is one of my many spirit animals.

animeList.title: Clannad: After Story
animeList.comment: Even though I didn't like the first season that much, After Story was certainly a fantastic experience, and one of the not too many times I ugly cried to any media.

animeList.title: Natsume's Book of Friends
animeList.comment: Highly consistently enjoyable series, and given the premise doesn't feel stagnant at all!

summary: Y'know what they say, an episode of Natsume a day keeps depression away.

animeList.title: Baccano!
animeList.comment: A wild and fun ride, definitely worth the time.

animeList.title: Gurren Lagann
animeList.comment: Over the top, exciting, and has all the hype!

animeList.title: Lucky Star
animeList.comment: Incredibly fun and was a vibe start to finish.

animeList.title: Mononoke
animeList.comment: Insanely unique and interesting, great animation style.

summary: 『ドリルは男のロマンって言うしゃん』- 此方泉 | "They say a drill is a man's romance" - Konata Izumi

animeList.title: Gintama
animeList.comment: GOAT, not elaborating here but if you want to hear my thoughts dm me on Discord!

animeList.title: Ouran High School Host Club
animeList.comment: Very gay (complimentary), very charming, and very enjoyable.

summary: Oh by the way I love Gintama. In case you didn't know, Gintama is my favorite Anime of all time. Did I ever mention Gintama is my top 1 rated Anime?

animeList.title: Mushishi
animeList.comment: Mushishi sets its atmosphere up perfectly, it feels like that one distant dream that gives you the warm and fuzzy feels all over.

summary: Not exaggerating here but I think the most tranquil state of mind that I've been in the past couple of years was most likely whenever I was listening to Mushishi's wonderful OPs, EDs, and OST.

animeList.title: Howl's Moving Castle
animeList.comment: Yet another beautiful and charming Ghibli tale, also one of my personal favorites. There's a moment in the movie that is guaranteed to make me tear up!

animeList.title: Monster
animeList.comment: One of the first series that I watched, hooked me since episode 1 and despite its length, did not feel like a chore to binge.

animeList.title: Paranoia Agent
animeList.comment: Satoshi Kon take an L challenge (IMPOSSIBLE).

animeList.title: Samurai Champloo
animeList.comment: It passes the vibe check with extra credit, go listen to the ED right now.

summary: I heckin' love Howl.

animeList.title: Kino's Journey
animeList.comment: Quite a charming tale, a journey with no destination, thoroughly enjoyable start to finish.

animeList.title: Planetes
animeList.comment: A unique and fascinating story, solid Sci-Fi Anime.

summary: The year I was born! Quote of the year: 『世界は美しくなんかない。そしてそれ故に、美しい』, or "The world is not beautiful. And that, in a way, lends it a sort of beauty", from Kino's Journey.

animeList.title: Azumanga Daioh
animeList.comment: An awesome Slice of Life Anime, and really damn funny. Also has one of my favorite characters: Osaka (she's just like me fr) o.o

animeList.title: Detective Conan: Phantom of Baker Street
animeList.comment: Even though I have my qualms with Detective Conan, I cannot get myself to hate its early content, especially this movie. It took the premise and went full creative mode, definitely a childhood favorite! The case itself was not the strongest however which is a shame.

animeList.title: Ghost in the Shell: Stand Alone Complex
animeList.comment: GitS is a classic, and SAC did not miss at all in terms of story nor character. A pleasant cyberpunk treat! I also highly recommend the original movie.

summary: Don't watch Detective Conan outside of this movie and the early episodes pls, it'll be a journey you end up regretting.

animeList.title: Spirited Away
animeList.comment: One of my few 10/10s, does not get old however many times I rewatch. A Ghibli classic in every way and one of Miyazaki's best.

summary: Not much to say here, if you have not seen Spirited Away yet what are you doing really? Go watch it!

animeList.title: FLCL
animeList.comment: It's bizzare but it works! Great animation and awesome experience.

animeList.title: Jin-Roh
animeList.comment: A wonderfully crafted tragedy, the ending segment sent chills down my spine, the pace is rather slow and it's rather violent though, be warned.

summary: Can't say I watched that many entries from this year, this was before I was born!
